column5: This morning was a HOOT.  I am always getting to my fishing spots way before light. I like to get all set and ready.  Coffee and a toasted bagel to get my belly ready for the mornings event.  This morning was a bit different. As I was getting my waders on and getting the gear ready, there was a couple of owls hooting away. Total darkness and listening to them chatter about was so cool to listen too. I listened for a bit then well,,,,,,,,,,,,,  I thought what the hell, put the camera on the back of the truck, press record, and try to chat with them.  It didnt take much to carry on a conversation with them. There was one to my right a fair distance away on the other side of the river. He seemed to be the one that wanted to chat the most. There was one to my right that joined in. He would hoot a bit and fly. I could hear him launch from tree to tree as his wings made a loud noise.( couldnt pick that up on the recording saddly) Is was a pretty cool experince.  Turn up the volume a bit. Sorry  for my bad hoot calls, but they seemed to work.
That is the amazing part of going fishing, you just never know what you'll get to experience on any given day.  Very cool Brian!!
You're a hoot! Listen for cougar calls,  you may want to record bthose too
"My ex husband was such an idiot.  You look like such a sweet young man. Buy me a drink, sweety?"
Very cool Brian   That's the pleasure of being outdoors
Thats awesome Brian!  All ive been hearing every night is coyotes. Starting to get annoying  Well lotsa geese too but I dont mind those
In hear you're back at Hooters again  lol  cool

Great Horned Owl   Thanks Dozer  I wonder if these owls will stay put once day light comes? If so, and I can  pin point the direction of the  calls in the dark, I could find one to take some pics. The trees are getting baron. Would they stand out?  Edit to add  I did notice the calling stopped just aspartial daylight had started.

Thanks Dozer  I wonder if these owls will stay put once day light comes? If so, and I can  pin point the direction of the  calls in the dark, I could find one to take some pics. The trees are getting baron. Would they stand out?  Edit to add  I did notice the calling stopped just aspartial daylight had started. They'll be in the same area but dam hard to find any big really big pine trees there??
Sorry Bro but you sound like an owl who spent the better part of his life growing up in "the village".
this is awesome, i thought i was the only crazy guy trying to talk to animals while fishing.   I talk to loons all the time while out in the boat. They make good company some evenings.
That is soooo cool Brian. The stuff we do when out there all alone without our medication  …lol…..
And don't sound like a barred owl you might get talons to the head

Yup rod,theres lots there. Check way up high and really close to the trunk of the tree they blend in so good also check for an old hawk nest they may take it over for there nest Great Horned Owl's don't make a nest them selves just take one over or sometimes you see a laundry basket in a tree with sticks in it some people try to help

And don't sound like a barred owl you might get talons to the head  Might explain why the one on the left was moving in fast.LOL  Now you got me worried.LOL  In hear you're back at Hooters again  lol  cool  LOL
That is soooo cool Brian. The stuff we do when out there all alone without our medication  …lol…..  Meds a so expensive,this med is natural. LOL
Sorry Bro but you sound like an owl who spent the better part of his life growing up in "the village".  The village? As in the village idiot? Yup, thats me.LOL
